name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"898ee248-2412-4164-a771-5066cbd125fb","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":1,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function: handle_scopes","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"107ad25b-4081-4439-bab0-21eaaf8372a5","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"handle_scopes","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" function is the logic center for integrating imported code into the current file's namespace. While ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"visit_Import","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" handles the mechanics of finding files, ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"handle_scopes","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" handles the "semantics" of the import—ensuring that when you import a function or class, it becomes available to use in your local code and correctly points back to its original definition.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c8b5fb5a-09a8-4778-9a48-c19b8f26a8c0","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Why this matters
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"In Python, an import statement effectively copies a reference from one module into another. If you write ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"from math import sqrt","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", your local file now has a name ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"sqrt","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" that points to the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"math","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" module's ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"sqrt","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". This function performs that "wiring." Without it, the analyzer would see ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"sqrt(25)","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in your code and flag ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"sqrt","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" as an undefined variable.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"2f4cb248-3fe8-4b2d-8ab6-e43cb422a4e6","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"How it works","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"412db3b6-bd38-4742-adea-dd001f633be0","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Context Retrieval:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It grabs the scope of the file currently being analyzed (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"current_scope","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") and the scope of the module being imported (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"imported_scope","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"82a5492e-d2d1-4882-a0ff-a394c1d21d80","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Handling Wildcards (","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"*","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"):","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[{"id":"039c92aa-45de-4e81-9a63-97ddadfc8f57","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"If the import is a "star import" (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"from utils import *","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), the function iterates through ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"every single definition","styles":{"italic":true}},{"type":"text","text":" found in the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"imported_scope","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"87c33aae-4a12-40d6-ac45-1adf7b949360","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"For each item found, it calls the inner ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"create_def","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" helper to create a local variable in the current file.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d575bf2a-82f2-4d9f-98ce-e1df1cc425d7","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It then links this local variable to the original definition, recording the line number.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"c4b0b1dd-3fad-4082-acb6-7286d126088c","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Handling Specific Imports:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[{"id":"cdd7edfa-4b7d-4746-9fae-ab2bf9c1b10a","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"If a specific item is imported (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"from models import User","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), it looks up ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"User","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"imported_scope","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e5030374-35cd-4e0d-8d4a-b4810e6a2dae","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It handles a subtle distinction: Is the user importing a ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"member","styles":{"italic":true}},{"type":"text","text":" of a module (like a function inside a file) or the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"module itself","styles":{"italic":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"import os","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":")?","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f48db7d3-b8e8-45aa-8ff5-faadae440fb2","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Aliasing:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It creates a local definition for the target name (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"tgt_name","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"). This handles aliasing automatically (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"from models import User as U","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" would create a local def ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"U","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c322c72b-2059-4305-bfe0-9d64c42abe14","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Linking:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Finally, it adds a "value point" to the local definition. This point acts as a pointer, saying "At line X, this variable was assigned the value of that remote definition."","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"1fa8d98e-003b-41fd-bd37-57f2a727efe7","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Example Scenario
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Consider the code:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7bac8dcb-9c6f-4993-9a3c-360abffbb594","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"# File: main.py
from internal_lib import helper_func as h","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c785c9c3-5324-4ed6-9293-7a58415113dc","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"When analyzing this line:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"5ad23e29-52d6-4755-9914-76f3654689b8","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"handle_scopes","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is called with ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"imp_name="helper_func"","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"tgt_name="h"","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"modname="internal_lib"","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4b9a9eda-d4c7-4bac-91cc-6c0212a9c383","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It looks inside the analyzed data for ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"internal_lib","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d005497a-084f-446b-b863-3836b125da6d","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It finds the definition for ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"helper_func","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" inside that module.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"99c1370e-e9d1-481d-bdfe-f72ac75c39ba","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It creates a new definition ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"h","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" inside ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"main.py","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"'s scope.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b6c50a43-ac1a-49d5-9d22-7be31f54f706","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It links ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"h","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"internal_lib.helper_func","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"be0d0e1f-9521-49fa-9bf6-6cbaf4ed9268","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, the analyzer knows that calling ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"h()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is actually calling ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"internal_lib.helper_func()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"32578249-ad58-479d-b3eb-08023785bf31","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
